title: FCE Mock 1
question:

I. Rights of unit holders are stipulated in the deed and offering documents
II. Unit holders do not have the right to require the funds' asset to be transferred to them
III. Investors are responsible for ensuring compliance with investment guidelines
IV. Unit holders liabilities are limited
explain:

I. Rights of unit holders are stipulated in the deed and offering documents
II. Unit holders do not have the right to require the funds' asset to be transferred to them
IV. Unit holders liabilities are limited

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Index Fund is also referred to as _________ due to its modus operandi of “tracking” an index.
explain: Index Fund is also referred to as TRACKER FUND due to its modus operandi of "tracking" an Index.

title: FCE Mock 1
question: The following examples are true about a Consultant abetting others in committing a misconduct, EXCEPT:
A: Collaborating with others in a scheme to carry out misconduct
B: Encouraging or directing another person to commit misconduct
C: Knowingly assisting another person, either through action or omission, to commit misconduct
D: It refers to when a Consultant reports acts of misconduct to FIMM
explain: It refers to when a Consultant reports acts of misconduct to FIMM

title: FCE Mock 1

PRS - Disclosure Document
Unit Trust - Prospectus
Source: Study Guide > Pg. 3-16

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
According to the World Bank’s multi-pillar framework, which of the following pillars are part of Malaysia’s retirement system?
I. Pillar 0 - State (Base or social pension)
II. Pillar 1 - Mandatory (Public pension plans that are publicly managed)
III. Pillar 2 - Mandatory (Occupational/personal pension plans)
IV. Pillar 3 - Voluntary (Voluntary personal pension schemes)
V. Pillar 4 - Voluntary (Non-financlal arrangements/informal support informal support e.g. family financial support by the younger generation)
explain: NOTE: Pillar 1 - Mandatory (Public pension plans that are publicly managed) is NOT AVAILABLE IN MALAYSIA

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
Which of the following scenarios where PRS withdrawals will be exempted from the 8% tax penalty?

II. Member is leaving Malaysia permanently
III. Member wants to repay housing loan

Il. Member is leaving Malaysia permanently

NOT FOR house renovation

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Which of the following is the primary role of a Trustee?

C: Making day-to-day investment decisions such as stock selection and portfolio allocation

question:
The followings are characteristics of investment linked funds:

- not subject to monitoring by a Trustee nor scrutiny by the SC

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
Which of the following statements are TRUE?
I. UTS/PRS investors do not purchase the securities in the portfolio directly
II. Ownership of the portfolio in a UTS is divided into units of entitlement and each investor is known as a “unit holder”
III. Investments within the UTS/PRS portfolio can increase or decrease in value, as such the value or “unit price” of each unit increases or decreases accordingly
IV. UTS/PRS investors are beneficiaries under a trust set up by the UTMC/PRS Providers
explain:
Correct statements:
I. UTS/PRS investors do not purchase the securities in the portfolio directly
II. Ownership of the portfolio in a UTS is divided into units of entitlement and each investor is known as a “unit holder”
III. Investments within the UTS/PRS portfolio can increase or decrease in value, as such the value or “unit price” of each unit increases or decreases accordingly
IV. UTS/PRS investors are beneficiaries under a trust set up by the UTMC/PRS Providers

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
Under the Securities Commission Act 1993 (SCA), the Securities Commission Malaysia (SC) is empowered to perform which of the following functions?
I. Developing the overall capital market and its market segments
II. Ensuring proper conduct of all market participants
III. Ensure listed companies consistently achieve their financial and revenue targets
IV. Approving authority for corporate bond issues
explain: Ensuring companies and businesses meet their revenue targets - is NOT the regulatory function of the SC.

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
Which of the following statements about Conflict of Interest under FIMM’s Code of Ethics are TRUE?
I. Consultants should conceal details of any conflict from their upline and distributor to prevent confusion
II. Where conflict of interest cannot be avoided, consultants have a responsibility to disclose the conflict to their investors in writing
III. Consultants must prioritise investors' interest in the event of conflict
IV. Only actual conflicts of interest, not perceived ones, need to be avoided
explain:
Where conflict of interest cannot be avoided, consultants have a responsibility to disclose the conflict to their investors in writing;
Consultants must prioritise investors' interest in the event of conflict

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
When FIMM receives a complaint from an investor, it may initiate an investigation. Which of the following actions is FIMM not empowered to take?
I. Require the consultant, distributor, or their representatives to provide a written explanation to address allegations
II. Require the Consultant, Distributor and the employees and agents of Distributor to freeze the investment account of the investor
III. Record statements from consultants, distributors, or other individuals who may assist with the investigation
IV. Request and obtain documents, books, records, or copies relevant to the investigation
explain: FIMM will carry out an investigation upon receiving a complaint from an investor. The following are the steps that FIMM may take during its investigation, EXCEPT: Require the Consultant, Distributor and the employees and agents of Distributor to freeze the investment account of the investor

A: Only trustee fee is charged to the UTMC/PRS Provider whereas custody fee is charged to the UTS/PRS
B: UTMC/PRS Provider pay for both trustee fee and custody fee
C: Unit holders pay for both trustee fee and custody fee
D: Both trustee fee and custody fee are charged to the UTS/PRS

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Bond Fund reported the following information as at 31 Dec 2025: Gross assets: RM500,000 Net assets: RM490,000 Number of units in circulation: 100,000 What is the unit price for Bond Fund?
explain: Calculation based on net assets, not gross: Unit Price = Net Assets ÷ Units in Circulation = RM490,000 ÷ 100,000 = RM4.90

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
Areas of financial planning include____
I. Risk management and insurance planning
II. Investment planning
III. Retirement and estate planning
IV. Time management

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Farah is a UTS and PRS Consultant. On her social media page, she posted the following: "Contact me NOW if you need help from a professional financial planner to start investing in UTS and PRS" Is this posting allowed? Please select the most appropriate reason for your answer.
A: Yes, Farah is allowed to use her status as a UTS and PRS consultant to market other products
B: No, Farah's posting is not allowed because she is misrepresenting herself as a financial planner
C: Yes, Farah's posting is allowed because as a consultant she is very knowledgeable about investment products
D: No, Farah is not allowed to use her social media account to market UTS and PRS

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
Which of the following statements are TRUE?
I. Personal financial planning covers a comprehensive approach where advice is given on an ongoing basis
II. Personal financial planning involves an understanding of a client's financial affairs, goals and personal objectives
III. A financial planner must be an expert in all technical aspects to produce an appropriate personal financial plan
IV. Personal financial planning generally involves dealing with other professionals appointed by a client
explain: A financial planner cannot be an expert in all the technical aspects necessary to produce an appropriate personal financial plan. A financial planner must interact with other professional advisers with whom the client currently has a relationship. For example, a client may have appointed an accountant, a taxation adviser, stockbroker and lawyer. Liaison with all these professionals would be an important part of ensuring that the client’s personal financial plan can be completed.

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
_____________ includes the following criteria?
I. An individual whose total net personal assets, or total net joint assets with his or her spouse, exceeding three million ringgit or its equivalent in foreign currencies, excluding the value of the individual's primary residence
II. A corporation with total net assets exceeding ten million ringgit or its equivalent in foreign currencies based on the last audited accounts
explain: Sophisticated Investors

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
An investment-linked fund is _______
I. Managed and promoted by a unit trust management company
II. Offered with a life insurance policy
III. Purchased with a single premium (lump sum investment) or with regular premium payments
IV. Required to comply with BNM's rules and regulations
explain: An investment-linked fund is NOT managed and promoted by a unit trust management company

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
UTS and PRS have the following characteristics where both of them ________
I. Provide diversification of asset
II. Require a Trustee to look after the interest of the investors

IV. Are schemes that encourage investors to make long-term savings and investment decisions

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Ali is a licensed financial planner who had advised her client, Sarah to invest in a balanced UTS. While Sarah agreed to the advice, Ali noticed that Sarah seemed hesitant and not convinced by this suggestion. What should Ali do?
A: Proceed with the account opening for Sarah to subscribe to the balanced UTS
B: To calmly and gently ask Sarah if she has any concerns regarding investing in a balanced UTS
C: To persuade Sarah that her advice is good and will help Sarah to meet her financial goals
D: To refuse to follow up or proceed with anything until Sarah explains her behaviour
explain: To calmly and gently ask Sarah if she has any concerns regarding investing in a balanced UTS

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Luqman is a Consultant who has taken a portion of his client’s money to make a personal online transaction. However, due to a network error, the online transaction was not successful. Did Luqman commit a misconduct? Please select the most appropriate reason for your answer.
A: Yes, he did because he committed forgery
B: No, he did not because the computing error prevented his from misappropriating his client’s money
C: Yes, she did because he misappropriated his client’s money regardless of the unsuccessful online transaction
D: No, he did not because his conduct did not cause the client to be worse off
explain: Any attempt (even unsuccessful) is considered as an action of misconduct

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Below is the particulars of Fatimah investment holding in a UTS/PRS as at 1 June 2025: (a) 2,000 units (b) NAV per unit: RM1.50 (c) A distribution of RM0.50 per unit was declared and paid on the same date in the form of fund units. How many number of units did Fatimah own after the distribution?
explain:
Distribution = 2,000 units x RM0.50 = RM1,000
NAV per unit after distribution = RM1.50 – RM0.50 = RM1.00
Units to be issued from the distribution = RM1,000 / RM1.00 = 1,000
Total units = 2,000 units + 1,000 units = 3,000 units

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
The Consultants are required to comply with minimum standards as set out in the SC's Guidelines on Advertising for Capital Market Products and Related Services, include:
I. Provide clear, fair and balanced information
II. Treat investors fairly at all times
III. Ensure information in advertisements are consistent with information disclosed in prospectus, disclosure document and product highlights sheet
IV. Take reasonable measures to inform investors that the advertisement is subject to any relevant warning, disclaimer, qualification or terms and conditions
explain:
The Consultants are required to comply with minimum standards as set out in the SC's Guidelines on Advertising for Capital Market Products and Related Services, include:
I. Provide clear, fair and balanced information
II. Treat investors fairly at all times
III. Ensure information in advertisements are consistent with information disclosed in prospectus, disclosure document and product highlights sheet
IV. Take reasonable measures to inform investors that the advertisement is subject to any relevant

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Please refer to the extracted financial statement for Growth Advance Fund, below: · Expenses as at 30 November 2025 · Management Fee: RM9,036,940 · Trustee Fee: RM302,165 · Auditors Fee: RM8,600 · Bank charges and other fees: RM4,850,000 The Management Expense Ratio (MER) of the Fund for the year ended 30 November 2025 was 1.56% What is the average fund size of Growth Advance Fund during the year?
explain:
Working formula = Total Expenses / Average Fund Size x 100% = 1.56%
Average Fund Size = Total Expenses / 1.56% x 100%
= RM14,197,705 / 1.56% x 100% = RM910,109,294.87

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Edmund recently became a registered unit trust consultant, which is his first and only qualification. In his social media page, he marketed himself as an investment advisor to attract potential investors. Did Edmund violate FIMM's Code of Ethics?
A: No. As a registered unit trust consultant, he is qualified to be an investment guru.
B: No. Everyone has the right to post whatever they want in social media.
C: Yes. As a unit trust consultant, he is required to comply with FIMM's Code of Ethics. Therefore, he is not allowed to use any unauthorised designations, titles or qualifications.
D: Yes. As a unit trust consultant, he is not allowed to post anything related to unit trust in social media.

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Which of the following statement is TRUE?
A: A Consultant is not allowed to disclose any documents or information to anyone at all times
B: A Consultant and Distributor shall disclose the documents or information in an open and co-operative manner as and when required by FIMM or other regulatory authorities
C: A Consultant is only allowed to disclose documents or information in an open and co-operative manner as and when required by FIMM or other regulatory authorities after getting permission from his/her Distributor
D: Only Distributors are allowed to disclose documents or information in an open and co-operative manner as and when required by FIMM or other regulatory authorities upon obtaining approval from the Securities Commission Malaysia (SC)

question:

I. Initial service charge
II. Annual management fee

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
Why do UTMCs declare unit split?
I. To reduce the NAV price per unit
II. To attract investors
III. To increase the number of units in the fund
IV. To increase the profit margins from sale of units
explain: Note: to increase the number of units in the fund is NOT the reason to declare unit split

title: FCE Mock 1
question:
Which of the followings are characteristics of a Shariah-compliant Scheme?
I. A Shariah-compliant Scheme can meet its investment objectives as long as it is within the scope of Shariah principles
II. The investment strategy would need to be aligned with the objective of a Shariah-compliant fund
III. The Scheme Provider must ensure that all daily operations of a Shariah-compliant Scheme comply with all the requirements of the Securities Commission Malaysia as well as Shariah requirements
IV. Compliance and supervisory function relating to Shariah matters are under the purview of the Schemes' Shariah Adviser/Committee
explain:
Characteristics of a Shariah-compliant Scheme:
I. A Shariah-compliant Scheme can meet its investment objectives as long as it is within the scope of Shariah principles
II. The investment strategy would need to be aligned with the objective of a Shariah-compliant fund
III. The Scheme Provider must ensure that all daily operations of a Shariah-compliant Scheme comply with all the requirements of the Securities Commission Malaysia as well as Shariah requirements
IV. Compliance and supervisory function relating to Shariah matters are under the purview of the Schemes' Shariah Adviser/Committee

title: FCE Mock 1
question: Which of the following is the FIRST STEP in financial planning?
B: Analyse and evaluate client's financial status

title: FCE Mock 1
question:

I. Cessation of the employee's employment
II. Merger or acquisition of the employer by another entity
III. Termination of the vesting schedule

explain:

Note: Cessation of the employee's employment (under various circumstance), kindly refer to study guide, point: 7B.145 (page 7B-27)

explain:
roles of a Consultant:

explain:
